name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $event
desc: Returns: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

name: $addevent
desc: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

name: $repeat
desc: Returns: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

name: $repeat.count
desc: Returns: A total count of the desired number of repetitions.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A total count of the desired number of repetitions.

name: $repeat.countMax
desc: Returns: A maximum value for the count of the desired repetitions (e.g. do something 6-8 times).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A maximum value for the count of the desired repetitions (e.g. do something 6-8 times).

name: $repeat.duration
desc: Returns: How long this thing happens for when it happens.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: How long this thing happens for when it happens.

name: $repeat.durationMax
desc: Returns: The upper limit of how long this thing happens for when it happens.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The upper limit of how long this thing happens for when it happens.

name: $repeat.durationUnit
desc: Returns: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The units of time for the duration, in UCUM units.

name: $repeat.frequency
desc: Returns: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period / period range (i.e. both period and periodMax provided).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The number of times to repeat the action within the specified period / period range (i.e. both period and periodMax provided).

name: $repeat.frequencyMax
desc: Returns: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so to repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: If present, indicates that the frequency is a range - so to repeat between [frequency] and [frequencyMax] times within the period or period range.

name: $repeat.period
desc: Returns: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur; e.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Indicates the duration of time over which repetitions are to occur; e.g. to express "3 times per day", 3 would be the frequency and "1 day" would be the period.

name: $repeat.periodMax
desc: Returns: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: If present, indicates that the period is a range from [period] to [periodMax], allowing expressing concepts such as "do this once every 3-5 days.

name: $repeat.periodUnit
desc: Returns: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The units of time for the period in UCUM units.

name: $repeat.dayOfWeek
desc: Returns: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).

name: $addrepeat.dayOfWeek
desc: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: If one or more days of week is provided, then the action happens only on the specified day(s).

name: $repeat.timeOfDay
desc: Returns: Specified time of day for action to take place.

name: $addrepeat.timeOfDay
desc: Specified time of day for action to take place.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Specified time of day for action to take place.

name: $repeat.when
desc: Returns: Real world events that the occurrence of the event should be tied to.

name: $addrepeat.when
desc: Real world events that the occurrence of the event should be tied to.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Real world events that the occurrence of the event should be tied to.

name: $repeat.offset
desc: Returns: The number of minutes from the event. If the event code does not indicate whether the minutes is before or after the event, then the offset is assumed to be after the event.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The number of minutes from the event. If the event code does not indicate whether the minutes is before or after the event, then the offset is assumed to be after the event.

name: $code
desc: Returns: A code for the timing schedule. Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A code for the timing schedule. Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data
